DOC.brief_summary: Life-threatening infection impairs bloodflow to the gut, thereby causing less delivery of oxygen. This leads to increased formation of lactic acid. The investigators hypothesize, that the more serious the condition, the higher the concentration of lactic acid will be, thus relating to the risk of multiple organ failure or death.
DOC.brief_title: Lactic Acid in the Rectum and Life-Threatening Infection
DOC.criteria: Fluid resuscitated septic shock < 24 h. Septic shock > 24 h. Pathology in the rectum. Bleeding per rectum. Limitation of therapy. Where informed consent from relatives cannot be obtained.
